231.title: Cancer 1.1
231.author: Anonymous
231.description: A collection of levels by Grimm, most following the design theme of having an exposed master goodie in the middle, surrounded by lesser goodies on other objects for players to duck behind and use to dodge incoming fire. Each level has a unique take on the theme, leading to entertaining and fierce fire fights. One unique level even features a gauge that shows when the master goody will respawn, which adds a new level of strategy. To paraphrase grimm, "It makes sweet, romantic love to your mother."

245.title: Clockwork Blue b4
245.author: Anonymous
245.description: The only known level that was released by Jonathan "Poverty" Voss. The level is a small arena with nowhere to hide, and falling off the edge means death. A decent enough level for fans of small arenas with fast death. While the level isn't terrible, nor really that great, poverty is a fantastic person. Known as "Mr. Hitler" to his fans, Poverty is a much loved and popular Avara player who was a very important part of Avara's growth and its history, and is surely loved by all players of the game. My hat goes off to you, Poverty, you're a true hero and God speed you! You'll surely have the entire Avara community voting for you in your presidential campaign!

268.title: Dildensburg
268.author: Anonymous
268.description: Dildensburg is a map created by Tyrant and Silverfox, recreating a small city area within Avara. The city includes a number of structures to explore from a hotel, warehouse and even a gas station complete with condom dispenser in the bathroom! It was built more as a novelty to play in and explore together, as it lacks sufficient goodies and is far too large for good matches. However, it is a great example of the versatility of the Avara engine, which is almost only limited by the imagination of the level designers. Definitely a great map to explore and have some fun in.

380.title: newmoon
380.author: Anonymous
380.description: From the popular level designer Silverfox, this is a closed in, multi-level arena that allows you to attack (or be attacked) from both above and below. A clever stacked design really adds a new dimension to the combat, allowing players to attack each other from ANY level, unlike many other multi-level arenas. Featuring a beautiful colour scheme, this level is a remix of one of Silverfox first levels, which is also included in the set for comparison.

448.title: strawberry
448.author: Anonymous
448.description: Strawberry is a unique 7 minute killfest from Ryan "Silverfox" Herriman. The arena is closed in with two levels. There are two variations included: one with grenades and one with missiles. The real unique touch is a goody located in the centre. Appearing rarely, it moves in an orbit, making it hard to catch and leaving you open to attack... but its effect is 30 seconds of invulnerability! Battles can become crazy as the sound of the power-up spawning is heard and race to grab it starts, leaving the losers to run scared around the arena until they can fight back with a vengeance.

160.title: SomeSet
160.author: Anonymous
160.description: Ladies and gentlemen, I present SomeSet! From famed level author SomeGuy, this set contains two award winning (that's right, award winning) levels, Western Shootout and Asylum! Originally only available for Aftershock, you can now play these the way they were meant to be played, in pure Avara! A number of never before seen levels are also included, set in locations such as a gas station, an abandoned city and even a nuclear reactor! Two novelty levels are included which offer unique gameplay, and a hidden level is waiting to be discovered! All these levels offer excellent gameplay! SomeSet is truly a masterpiece of design, a fine tribute to the epic legacy SomeGuy created. Get it today and relive the glory days of Avara!

149.title: gobi
149.author: Anonymous
149.description: "My first released level set...21 levels, most of them new. Some were previously released in T Plus 5". A decent collection of normal levels from PatH. While they aren't going to make Silverfox or Tyrant run for cover, they aren't too bad either. Get it if you're looking for some more normal levels.

145.title: derelict
145.author: Anonymous
145.description: Derelict features the now famous Windshire level. Designed by Tyrant, Windshire is a solo level with the aim of sneaking into and robbing a bank. Needless to say, the level features Tyrants usual creative and tricky design, but unfortunately it will remain unfinished. Luckily, it's still very playable. Yet another great example of the possiblities the Avara engine offers.

382.title: not-aa
382.author: Anonymous
382.description: New regular set from the brains behind AfterShock. Some fun layouts, and then there's the speeders set. Kinda fun-with new hulls and all- but the race courses are rather long. Definitely above average.

270.title: DodgeBall2.5
270.author: Anonymous
270.description: Another unique idea from Shakespeare, this one harkens back to the olde elementary school game of Dodgeball. Get hit by the ball, and you're out - or in this case - dead. A nice change-of-pace when you're tired of the normal killing Avara games. Grab This Set!

353.title: Last Stand 1.0.sea
353.author: Anonymous
353.description: A somewhat difficult solo mission where you lay waste to some baddies. Distance and evasion are keys to winning this one. This is the first level release from Firestorm. [admin] Oooof, someone adjust Firestorm's monitor! This level is WAY too dark to be any fun. Can't judge what you can't see.[/admin]

202.title: AvaraCollection1.sea
202.author: Anonymous
202.description: The first (and only) "Official" collection from Ambrosia, this set took several levels from various authors and combined them into one set. This set includes the following levels: Blockparty, John B v1.8, Playground v1.4, Ruins of Coatepetl, Sausage Levels v1.3, Spring and Winter.

148.title: fsgb4
148.author: Anonymous
148.description:
Essentially calling development on Fishrack Gold dead, here it is.

You will, however, not be disappointed

389.title: Over the Hill
389.author: Anonymous
389.description: Over The Hill is the third geezer set released. As you might guess from the name, it contains "abnormal" KOTH (King Of The Hill) versions of some of the popular geezer levels.

303.title: Grecian Formula.sit
303.author: Anonymous
303.description: The fourth geezer set released in May of 1998 brings them back to "semi-normal" levels, but now they're getting more elaborate with the level scripting. Several "jousting" type levels, a few racing to the spot ones, and a few very normal levels round out this set.

208.title: Balledness
208.author: Anonymous
208.description: The fifth geezer set released in February on 1999, this one is the geezers take on Ball Games. Containing the popular GzrBall level, SnapBall and others including Kniqs "Heimlich" levels.

212.title: Best-of-96
212.author: Anonymous
212.description:
A collection of solo levels (supposedly) released in 1996. Included are Arena with Eight Sides, Bad Colour Scheme, blind, Blockhouse, Dogeball 3.0 and II, Hawthorne, Helter skelter, Lasagna, LionBall, Monolith lite, Red, Spring, and Winter.
If you don't have all these solo levels, grab this.

277.title: Essential Levels
277.author: Anonymous
277.description:
I've collected the most played classic Avara levels for one stop easy downloading. Get these levels and you will be ready to go! 

This set includes: Fosfori, Geriatric Ward, Grecian Formula, Liver Spots, AA Collection, AA Deux, AA Tré, Avara Collection 1, Balledness, Over the Hill, PastaBravo, R.I.P., and Wrestling 4.0.

-Kniq

364.title: Medievos
364.author: Anonymous
364.description: THis is the level that you could not get for long time unless you have hotline.It has a castle with staircases and in the closet there is a tube which when shot destroys the area of castle it is in.Plus several other tubes which increase speed etcetra.i would suggest getting this map.

390.title: Overture
390.author: Anonymous
390.description: Gus Wiseman (Mondo) turns in a good set of varied levels here. Nice work all around.

356.title: Liver Spots
356.author: Anonymous
356.description: The second geezer set released, it contains several fine levels including Desert Storm (Baghdad with non-locking missiles), Bermuda - a triangle layout level, SpaceJam and SpaceWalk - two low-G levels, along with a few more.

413.title: R.I.P.
413.author: Anonymous
413.description: Released in March of 2000, R.I.P. may be the last geezer set produced for Avara v1.0. This set includes Scrambled! and Infinity, two levels that have randomly created layouts - unique to the Avara world! It also includes revised versions of Baghdad and Showdown and Hopscotch that include random incarnators.

400.title: Pheel
400.author: Anonymous
400.description: Another level with the invisible floor bit. Geeze. Some fun layouts and nice colors.

190.title: AnonymousCollection
190.author: Anonymous
190.description: Created by the "unknown" author, this collection pulls the best levels from all of the "un" sets, including unknown, unnamed, untitled, unappreciated and unwanted. Viewed best when using the Scorekeeper plug-in.

226.title: Box-O-Spheres
226.author: Anonymous
226.description: A large IceBox clone with spheres instead of blocks. Hey mister, can I have my ball back?

173.title: 4isles
173.author: Anonymous
173.description:
4 Isles by Gus "Mondo" Wiseman.
A challenging myst-like solo level, 4 Isles features atmospheric music and difficult puzzles.

297.title: Geriatric-Ward
297.author: Anonymous
297.description: A blockbuster! The first geezer level set released, this one contains a few archetype levels including Baghdad and Showdown.

165.title: AvaraleveldesignDocMaker
165.author: Anonymous
165.description: This is just the Avara Level Design file in an easier to use DocMaker format for easy look up of varibles and objects etc. The Convertion was made by Tycho Maudd

182.title: Abranti
182.author: Anonymous
182.description: Another group of levels by Puck that are very playable. If you play in  a medium hull, think about switching to a light for some of these.

183.title: Abstraction.sit
183.author: Anonymous
183.description: Four excellent levels from trueno "the ever-changing". For a change of pace, play these once in a while.

187.title: Actung!
187.author: Anonymous
187.description: All of these Malkavian levels are incorporated into the AA Deux set.

188.title: Alakuloinen.sit
188.author: Anonymous
188.description: All of silverfox's level sets are works of art, and fun to play. Gentle on the eyes and soothing to the mind, they are a joy to play on the net. An essential download if there ever was one.

192.title: apollo
192.author: Anonymous
192.description: Turn your friends into confetti! Apollos first set, the "Apollo Contingency" includes 10 unique levels (and one KOTH remix) for net play. Battle within the Temple of Ares, where Atlas Fell, or in the bounds of the now famous Concert Hall.

197.title: Aucontab.sit
197.author: Anonymous
197.description: A nice set of levels (both normal and abnormal) from Tyrant, including some very good abnormal ones! Check out Hot Potato and Ransack. Very playable.

203.title: avaraladderset
203.author: Anonymous
203.description: The set of levels needed to play in the Avara Ladder (12/2001). Includes a few choice levels from previous sets, plus a few extra ones! Good luck to all those who participate, and may the best player win... or could it be the luckiest?

204.title: AvaraScape Octagon
204.author: Anonymous
204.description: Probably the best effort by Frenzy - this is almost an essential - small killfest arena play. Fun, fun, fun.

214.title: BladeRelease
214.author: Anonymous
214.description: This is my first set ever.  I tought myself how to create Avara levels, and started putting ideas together.  This set is about one year of work for me in my free time.  It has four, yes four, levels which are all unique.  I do have a version of Icebox, if you want to call it that, but it isn't really much like  the original other than it consists mainly of sliding obstacles.  I don't know if anyone has done a level like my fourth one.  It is a five room house with a patio.  You can fight in it, but there is only so much room, and it is very detailed so slower machines won't be able to give the player a good battle.  All of the levels in this set not only are for Avara, but work well with Aftershock, too.  Have fun with the levels and enjoy.  Let me know if you like them: Jonahswarrior@yahoo.com

217.title: Blockade
217.author: Anonymous
217.description: A fun, average little level by Vulcan, complete with "machine gun" nests, and protected ammo spots.

219.title: BlockParty.sit
219.author: Anonymous
219.description: This set has been combined into the Avara Collection 1 set.

223.title: Bostich-2.0
223.author: Anonymous
223.description: Several nice levels here by Mentos. Colors pleasing to the eye and layouts to provide some interesting battles. Tired of the same old stuff? Grab this set and explore some new levels!

232.title: Carbon v2.sit
232.author: Anonymous
232.description: Another fine art set of levels by silverfox, includes the wonderful Migraine, and of course the namesake level Carbon.

234.title: Carnage 2.0
234.author: Anonymous
234.description: Interesting levels from Lord Anon III. This set replaces the heavy hull with an "Ultra Light", including a different looking head. Some fun ideas in here, check them out sometime!

235.title: Carnage-3
235.author: Anonymous
235.description: More level fun from Lord Anon III, these levels embellish on the Carnage 2.0 set.

242.title: Chut
242.author: Anonymous
242.description: Don't fall down onto the floor, because there are mines down there, and no way to get back to the upper area. If I only had a ramp...

243.title: Clan Wars
243.author: Anonymous
243.description: A rather nice battleground for two teams. This one actually works quite well. No extraneous trees or other garbage, just some walls, guards, and ammo. Go ahead. Make my day.

246.title: Cnemies-Squares-20
246.author: Anonymous
246.description: Levels by Cnemie. Built to illustrate that Avara is about killing, pure and simple. No place to hide, so get in there and mix it up!

249.title: Collector
249.author: Anonymous
249.description: Several nice levels from D'Keeper, most involving KOTH-like games. Capture the switch (it moves around) for points. Well worth the download.

252.title: Corashie
252.author: Anonymous
252.description: This level by Seven has been incorporated into the AA Deux set.

253.title: Cosmik Debris
253.author: Anonymous
253.description: These levels created by me ELOISE have been incorporated into the AA Deux collection.

259.title: Cursorial
259.author: Anonymous
259.description: Levels by Cnemie. This 5 level set contains Cursorial and Saltatorial (two finely-tuned layouts), Arrogance, Insomniac and Five Polys.

279.title: fishrackSyndrome.sit
279.author: Anonymous
279.description: Oh man...I can't believe I never put Fishrack on here, with FSGold on the horizon...  Ah well about the levels, they aren't normal, but, at least in my opinion, many are playable.  Yes some are junk, but that's why I'm making Gold.  I like playing this set.  But don't take my word for it!

293.title: FunkyDome v2.sit
293.author: Anonymous
293.description: Now THIS is FUNKY! And FUN! Especially the Low-g level. Play that funky music...

311.title: Hamlet-1.1
311.author: Anonymous
311.description: Great layout by Shakespeare, except for the sound intro countdown. I think this level is included in a set somewhere, but I can't think of it at the moment.

318.title: HIB Collection1.sit
318.author: Anonymous
318.description: Some fun levels from Hectors In Black (HIB). Worth the download.

322.title: HTemple1.1.sit
322.author: Anonymous
322.description: A dark, fun stalking level. Gets a bit crowded with more than four though.

334.title: InternetShorthand
334.author: Anonymous
334.description: Some fun levels in here... well kinda fun... yeah- I'd say they're fun. Kinda like Goldilocks fun - not TOO fun, and not unfun - just plain fun.

487.title: Untitled
487.author: Anonymous
487.description: The khopywright level has been combined into the Anonymous Collection set. The other two (khorner and khrimp) are not in the collection.

498.title: Wild-west-collection
498.author: Anonymous
498.description: A bunch of levels by Cowboy, some of these ended up in Geriatric Ward. A few that didnt make it in GW are still fun to play though. Check them out!

321.title: Holy Hand Grenades 2.0
321.author: Anonymous
321.description: A fun set. Copies of some of the original levels modified by Malkavian to include very powerful grenades and missiles. Also included is Lemon Lender and Confederatio Helvetica II, which were included in the AA Collection.

357.title: LivingLevels.sea
357.author: Anonymous
357.description: From D'Keeper, released 8/28/00, his first released set in years.  "Living Levels" explores one of the possibilities raised by the random scripting first seen in "R.I.P." from the Geezers.  All six levels feature constantly-changing random layouts.  Try it, it's fun!  (Admin comment) Get This Set! It's Great! (/Admin comment )

429.title: SausageLevels 1.5.sit
429.author: Anonymous
429.description: This set has been combined into the Avara Collection 1 set.

482.title: Unappreciated
482.author: Anonymous
482.description: This set has been combined into the Anonymous Collection set.

499.title: Winters-Tale
499.author: Anonymous
499.description: Five wonderful levels by Shakespeare, when youre tired of the "same old same old", grab this set and have some fun!

195.title: Assassins-Guild-New
195.author: Anonymous
195.description: A few levels put together by the Assassin's. Nothing special here- a few Icebox clones, and a Slick copy if you can believe it. Don't bother....

237.title: Catrap-Net-Levels
237.author: Anonymous
237.description: Catrap had some fun making these basketball court levels, and played with some settings in Asgard from the Berserkir Fury set. Nothing exciting here...

254.title: Countermeasures10.sit
254.author: Anonymous
254.description: A very nice solo level! Made by Mangulator, this level is a fine addition for anyone who is seeking more solo levels to play. I couldn't find the final win teleporter, but overall it's a fine piece of work! Congrats!

276.title: Elevator Madness 1.0
276.author: Anonymous
276.description: A very interesting concept where slabs on a checkerboard floor rise up when you walk on them. Too bad the ammo is up in the air, requiring you to ride one of the corner slabs to get to them. Overall a fun level, well worth the download!

352.title: Last Dance.sit
352.author: Anonymous
352.description: D'Keeper presents a compilation of all of his best levels, including many never-before-seen ones.  With 16 normal levels and 8 abnormals, this set contains something for everyone.  Get it already!

479.title: UFO Levels
479.author: Anonymous
479.description: A set of five levels, some just variations on the IceBox theme. The outstanding one is BioBoosted - a tight, little space with killer fast missles and slightly boosted grenades. Get set for a killing spree!

486.title: Unplayable v1.0.1
486.author: Anonymous
486.description: Created by the "unknown" author, this set contains solo levels for you to practice your moves. Think you can dance the dance? Try these on for size.

172.title: -Poetic Justice-
172.author: Anonymous
172.description: Levels designed by Kyle "Vader" Blessing. Poetic Justice is a normal level set, Psychodelic Phuzz is an abnormal set. Enjoy!

185.title: Achilles-rage
185.author: Anonymous
185.description: Yes, the famed killer Achilles made these two levels, and while they're not bad- they're just short of being good, mostly because of the color scheme chosen. Large open fields with obstacles.

206.title: Avarathon-101
206.author: Anonymous
206.description: An interesting set of "racing" levels - complete with new hector heads. The object here is not to kill, but to run as fast as you can and complete the course. Of course, if you kill someone that delays them from completing. If you're tired of the same old levels - try this one, but it tires quickly.

273.title: Dumbster
273.author: Anonymous
273.description: What could have been a brilliant solo level is reduced to the core of it's name - dumb. No clear signs of what you need to do, nor how to get into some of the areas. Someone take this level, and do it right!

325.title: icevoc
325.author: Anonymous
325.description: Picture a bit of IceBox (with big non-moving blocks) with a bit of blind. Blocks are a bit big and hard to see opponents unless you're up on the surrounding perch.

378.title: Nafindix
378.author: Anonymous
378.description:
By Gus "Mondo" Wiseman.
Several small net level as well as a few big ones. Goodies are plentiful and playability is optimal.

381.title: Nire
381.author: Anonymous
381.description: By Gus "Mondo" Wiseman. My fourth set. Nire consists of several different variations of net play. Even contains a few non-symetrical levels. (!)

141.title: auroraBorealis
141.author: Anonymous
141.description:
My first level set. Not too spectacular, but the capture the flag levels are ok. - Plastic Chicken

Rather average levels that seem to focus more on the nice lighting than the design (hence the set title, referencing the northen lights). Still, it was a good first effort and are by no means terrible.

161.title: yerbabuenaClassic
161.author: Anonymous
161.description:
A stupid version of Sabor Yerbabuena. It gives windoz uzers a chance. - Plastic Chicken.

How could I possibly say it better than that?

174.title: A Bridge Too Far
174.author: Anonymous
174.description: Made by Vulcan, this level is a masterpiece, although playability suffers a bit. The fighting takes place on a bridge with a surface that can be destroyed.

177.title: AA Collection
177.author: Anonymous
177.description: The first collection from the AA, this set includes a "Normal" set and an "Abnormal" set. This is one of the standard level sets to have when playing on the net.

178.title: AA Deux
178.author: Anonymous
178.description: The second level set from the AA, again following the original design with both a "Normal" and "Abnormal" set. Yet another standard to have if youre a serious player.

216.title: Blind
216.author: Anonymous
216.description: Get This Level! An elegant bit of work by mantis, this should be in every Avara players' folder of levels.

238.title: Chaos Airbase 1.1
238.author: Anonymous
238.description: Pretty much a solo level where you try to shoot down a heavily armored UFO. Nice work by Gen. Chaos on the layout and the look of the level.

267.title: DesertSiege
267.author: Anonymous
267.description: A very nice solo level done by "Sir Ian", the only flaw I found was there was no "Red Teleporter" to find once I had killed all of the enemy. Good work though!

278.title: Fast-.sit
278.author: Anonymous
278.description: Three slightly different versions of the same level, which is unnerving because all of them have an invisible floor. Something about walking on nothing bothers me. Does it bother you?

323.title: Hunting1.2.sit
323.author: Anonymous
323.description: Yet Another Great Set By Shakespeare. Green and Yellow are the colors of the day, one being the hunted, the others being the hunters. Grab some friends, and get some action going... see who can last the longest.

484.title: Unknown.sit
484.author: Anonymous
484.description: Most of this set has been combined into the Anonymous Collection set (except for khraforence).

485.title: Unnamed
485.author: Anonymous
485.description: This set has been combined into the Anonymous Collection set.

489.title: Unwanted
489.author: Anonymous
489.description: This set has been combined into the Anonymous Collection set.

403.title: pimp
403.author: Anonymous
403.description: You know the name, now play the set. The pimpest levels around, complete with pimp sounds. New, different, and refreshing. So download it already.

162.title: alm-1.0.0-install.img.sit
162.author: Anonymous
162.description: NEO Software has released their Avara Level Manager. From their website:  Avara Level Manager is the first application, that lets you manage big level sets as easy as dropping icons around in the finder.  Avara Level Manager is freeware, that means, you can give it to anybody you want, as long the application is complete.  System Requirements: · Macintosh PPC · 20 MB RAM · MacOS 8 or later.  Freeware, may be given away to anyone, as long the ReadMe files are with it...

176.title: A.1
176.author: Anonymous
176.description: Several very nice levels by Puck. I especially like Work and also Worked (a larger version of Work.) If youre tired of the run-of-the-mill levels, give these a try.

180.title: Abluent.sit
180.author: Anonymous
180.description: An interesting bunch of levels by inio, some are quite playable.

181.title: Abnormality
181.author: Anonymous
181.description: Levels culled from other sets, this one highlights the abnormal levels of 1998. Nothing new here as far as I can see.

184.title: Acceleration Hector.sit
184.author: Anonymous
184.description: Four levels from Rhys McTharin. Most are very dark, making it almost impossible to see anything. Anyone got a candle? Maybe a flashlight?

191.title: AnTika.sit
191.author: Anonymous
191.description: I'd say don't bother with this one, but Temple of Krabe is kinda fun! I just wish it was a bit smaller, and the drop off delay wasn't so long. Worth the download to take a look.

194.title: Armageddon 2.0
194.author: Anonymous
194.description: A few fun levels, but some are unplayable. The highlight level is RANCID!, even though the ramps are almost too steep to get up every time.

198.title: Avara Hall Of Fame 1.0
198.author: Anonymous
198.description: Not! This level set by Viking "features" a bunch of levels named after several players. Too bad the players play better than these levels could ever be played. Yawn

211.title: BattleShips
211.author: Anonymous
211.description: An interesting concept of turning the popular board game into an Avara level. The Read Me is required to understand the procedure, but it is fun (once or twice.) Not horrible- but again it'll get tiresome fast.

227.title: BoxIn
227.author: Anonymous
227.description: Another very fun idea brought to the avara environment, but again after a couple of games you'll tire of this also. It would be more fun if you had more than just one life per game. An interesting level, worth playing if you're bored.

250.title: Confinement
250.author: Anonymous
250.description: A set of normal, average levels by "a fool".  A few are actually quite fun.

269.title: Disk-o-tech Light 1.0b
269.author: Anonymous
269.description:
I'm having flashbacks to the 70s, and it's not pretty. Neither is this level. Nice looking, in a way, but there is NO playability here. 
Here Tommy, play this record, it won't hurt you... "Stayin' Alive...Stayin' Alive..."

271.title: Doggity Levels 1.5
271.author: Anonymous
271.description: A few average levels here, one real outstanding one called "chess" that we used to play a lot. A low-g level with some traction effects. Woohoo!

272.title: Dramatis-Personae
272.author: Anonymous
272.description: More fun from Shakespeare, these are a bit more average than his other sets.

274.title: Dynamite
274.author: Anonymous
274.description: Imagine needing to suffer through a 15 second drop before you get into a very BADLY designed level. Oh yeah, this one will never make the download chart-toppers list. Use this level to line your bird cage.

275.title: Elements
275.author: Anonymous
275.description: The first level set from Sir Gawain, all of these levels have been incorporated into the AA Deux set.

285.title: Fosfori.sit
285.author: Anonymous
285.description: Another gorgeous level set from silverfox here, grab it to complete your level collection.

286.title: Four-Stomachs-Strike-Again
286.author: Anonymous
286.description: Kinda nice levels here. Play is fun, and layouts are good. Wow- am I getting soft after only the F's??

287.title: Four-Winds
287.author: Anonymous
287.description: I was gonna write to not bother with this one, but South WInd is kind really amusing and fun. Grab it- it's a nice change of pace.

291.title: FunBalls
291.author: Anonymous
291.description: This set would have been so much FUN, if there was a bit more space between all those blocks. Great concept, just the layout needs a bit of adjusting. I wish one level would have had outer walls that kept the balls bouncing a bit.

312.title: HardCandy
312.author: Anonymous
312.description: Average levels here. Some interesting play- but on the whole - average.

313.title: HDGs Box
313.author: Anonymous
313.description: A small arena box with some interesting obstacles in the layout. Makes for some interesting battles.

324.title: I-Candy
324.author: Anonymous
324.description: I-Candy is a demonstration set to show you the possibilities you can acheive within the Avara level framework. None of these levels are really for actual play. Kinda nice to look at - but some have over 200 polygons and slow down my G3 even.

327.title: In The Shadow
327.author: Anonymous
327.description: Average bunch of levels here. Playable, but not exciting. What do you think Spot?  "WOOF!"

330.title: Infernos Playground
330.author: Anonymous
330.description: You ever get real tired while driving for hours at the wheel? This level is kinda like that feeling...

333.title: InternetShorthand-v2
333.author: Anonymous
333.description: Slightly updated version of Internet Shorthand.

407.title: poetic justice
407.author: Anonymous
407.description:
There are 2 sets included: Poetic Justice, and Psychedelic Phuzz. PJ is made up of normal levels, while PP has abstrac levels. Most of these levels are large scale battlefields meant for 4+ players. However, there are still very fast paced levels included in both sets. Have fun, and long live Avara!

-Kyle "Vader" Blessing

461.title: The Mine
461.author: Anonymous
461.description:
by Gus "Mondo" Wiseman.
The Mine is a huge and enthralling solo level. You are left to solve a mystery that has left several hectors destroyed... then you must find a way out of "The Mine."

462.title: The Shire.b1.sea
462.author: Anonymous
462.description: Based on Tolkien's classic books. The Shire will bring you underground where you can only see a few feet. To the burial grounds of ancient king. This is Beta 1 version so expect a little quirkyness with the river level. It is nothing serious and only is slightly annoying.

472.title: TI
472.author: Anonymous
472.description: Totalitarian Irrationalism by Gus "Mondo" Wiseman. Seven net levels, mostly small and quick with pleasing color scemes.

488.title: Untold.sit
488.author: Anonymous
488.description:
This set is not by the unknown author, but instead by zer0. Interestingly enough- the third level in this set indicates it is indeed authored by "unknown", but is that just a mistake?
These levels do not feel like the other "un" levels.

298.title: Glenn 1.0
298.author: Anonymous
298.description: Another IceBox clone. Let's hope it's the last. (It won't be....)

156.title: Overlord1
156.author: Anonymous
156.description:
This is a little level set with a few, small, and nice levels I made for the original avara - made for network play.
Version 1.0 : 1st septembre, 2000

by Ulrik "TheOverlord" Sverdrup

193.title: Arena2.5
193.author: Anonymous
193.description: The roster note says this is an early release of a level from the Claw clan level set, which I don't think ever saw the light of day. If someone has this set, please upload it! As to the level, it's a big arena with LOTS of blocks in it. Ho hum.

201.title: AvaraBall2.0
201.author: Anonymous
201.description: A nice rendition of a basketball court, complete with backboards.

205.title: AvaraScapes 1.0
205.author: Anonymous
205.description: Three levels by Frenzy. Ho hum.

228.title: Breakfast-of-Champions
228.author: Anonymous
228.description: Breakfast includes a few average levels from YorB. Good effort.

236.title: Castle Anthrax.sit
236.author: Anonymous
236.description: Hybrid did a lot of work for this level, which has a huge number of polygons in it. It includes a slightly simplier version for anyone who wants to try and play this over the net. It's dark, like a castle should be.

240.title: Chicken-Little
240.author: Anonymous
240.description: Three levels from CHAOS. Killer tomatoes is kinda fun... You have no ammo- just tomatoes (red balls) around you can shoot into bounce walls. If they touch you- you're dead.

260.title: Dangr
260.author: Anonymous
260.description: A few nice levels that seem to be a bit too big. Couple have invisible floors with blocks and stuff sticking up. Kinda cool, but unnerving at first. Pillr is cool.

266.title: Death From Afar
266.author: Anonymous
266.description: "A bit like Choke, but a bit different" says the author. Hehe. Right. A missiles only level that's as open an Iowa prairie field. Ooo that's a bit too mean. Tough.

295.title: FuturePark
295.author: Anonymous
295.description: A great premise for a solo level, this unfortunately is a net play level. Layout is interesting and fun, but play is a bit weak.

310.title: Hadesv1.3.sit
310.author: Anonymous
310.description: A single platform level with a hole in the middle that you want to avoid. A small, intense level, but the drop is a bit long...

315.title: HeartBurn-Levels
315.author: Anonymous
315.description: Four average levels, two of which are modified copies of some of the original included levels. You decide if it's worth it.

316.title: Heaven
316.author: Anonymous
316.description: Two levels. Both would be good except they don't have enough ammo goodies, and the second - once you fall off, you're stuck on the ground. Kinda boring for a 1x1 play.

328.title: In Your FaceBall.sit
328.author: Anonymous
328.description: Large open arena is the layout of the day here - no- i mean LARGE arena. No, Larger STILL. Now you have the idea. Actually, Target in this set is kinda cool...

438.title: Slips Nade Practice
438.author: Anonymous
438.description: Some might think this is dumb but this level is very useful for practicing with genades. The Ufo is indistructible and you have infinite lives. It also doubles as combat practice with other HECTORS. If you hit the floor, points are docked, but if you hit the Ufo they'll be awarded. You don't realy need to worry about the score, you can't win. You're done when you're done. Have fun, Slip Stick.

369.title: Mohammeds Radio.sit
369.author: Anonymous
369.description: My first level set ,  I've tried to do something different here but I'm not sure if I succeeded. Download it and see what you think. (admin) Nice first try - keep working! (/admin)

199.title: Avara-fun-box
199.author: Anonymous
199.description: Levels from MotoHead and Jabba, these fall a bit short in the playability area.

233.title: Carnagathos
233.author: Anonymous
233.description: "A big level for big battles" it says. More like "A big layout so you'll never FIND an opponent." The level time limit is 40 minutes, and you'll need every one of them.

175.title: A Collection
175.author: Anonymous
175.description: A few mediocre levels from A Nonymouse. Actually mediocre is being generous.

179.title: Abandoned-warehouse
179.author: Anonymous
179.description: This set is painfully uninspiring. Warehouse is just a big room with ammo sprinkled around the floor. The four levels are just variations on the number of lives you have. Sorry - but dont bother here.

186.title: Acme-Labs-3
186.author: Anonymous
186.description: Three versions of the same level - some reduced because of the amounts of polygons used slowed weak machines. Unfortunately, none of them are much fun. Download this one if you want to look at some of the tricks in the big level, but don't bother trying to play it over the net.

189.title: Amaze Me!
189.author: Anonymous
189.description:
Ohh, gee. Let's create two huge mazes where you cannot see anyone until they're right in front of you. I know - let's make the passageways so tight your hectors get caught!
Don't bother with this one.

196.title: Athene
196.author: Anonymous
196.description: Two levels by Captain Blaze... enough said.

200.title: Avara Ball 1.0e.sit
200.author: Anonymous
200.description: The last known beta version of AvaraBall, the final was (to my knowledge) never released. A massive ball game level that really never caught on.

207.title: BAB.sit
207.author: Anonymous
207.description: I pity the fools who download this set. How to put this nicely... This %^$# sucks big time. Even the author says so in the read me. Beta versions of a bunch of unfinished levels. This shouldn't ever have been uploaded to the site.

209.title: Barena-1.1
209.author: Anonymous
209.description: Hmmm, a few dark levels here. Average by any measure.

210.title: Battle-Ball.sit
210.author: Anonymous
210.description: Two below-average levels by Whyte Shadow. Don't bother here.

213.title: Bile
213.author: Anonymous
213.description: A medium sized arena with a big ball, and a few little balls... oh and some blocks. Yeah, blocks. And Balls. Oh- almost forgot the walls! And Blocks. Did I mention a big ball?

218.title: Blockout
218.author: Anonymous
218.description: A Pepto-Bismol colored floor, and a few blocks. Yawn

221.title: Bloxers
221.author: Anonymous
221.description: YABL    ==  Yet Another Block Level. Egads, and not very imaginative either.

222.title: Bokerscoll.sit
222.author: Anonymous
222.description: Three versions of the same, boring level. Hang it up buddy.

225.title: BountyHunting.sit
225.author: Anonymous
225.description: If you like levels where all you have are laser guns - you'll like this. Otherwise it's just a bunch of average levels without any grenades or missiles.

230.title: Caldwell-11
230.author: Anonymous
230.description: designed by ELDoce, this map is a rendition of the town square of Caldwell, Texas, ca. 1880, the buildings are rustic, the courthouse tall. That is, of course, what that huge blocky looking brown structure in the center of town is.

239.title: Checkers
239.author: Anonymous
239.description: A rather large level with a checkerboard in the middle of it. Help! Someone help! I know there must be a message here I'm missing... Call 911! Is there a psychiatrist in the house?

244.title: Cloak
244.author: Anonymous
244.description: A nice (but big) black and grey level, except that the humps in the middle have ammo on top, but I can't get up there! Tried all of the hulls too, and every trick (even superjump.)The word is called beta-testing folks. Try it sometime.

248.title: Collection of Pain 3.0
248.author: Anonymous
248.description: More levels from CHAOS. Pain is such a existential force. Some can block it with their minds. I can't block the pain this set caused. Scarred for life I am. I'll never be the same.I said, "Bernie," I said "I'll never be the same." "No - you won't" is all he said.

256.title: Cross
256.author: Anonymous
256.description: A rather large level - shaped like a cross no less - with ammo at the far end of each section.Wait - just a minute - let me run ALL THE WAY DOWN HERE for more ammo. What? Can't you wait a minute?

262.title: Dark Arena
262.author: Anonymous
262.description: Yes it is - dark that is. "Show me the way to go home...."

263.title: Dark Sorcery.sit
263.author: Anonymous
263.description: A few levels that would be fun, but are not. Large arenas and viewing obstacles block any hope of finding another hector in these large areas.

264.title: Daves Arena
264.author: Anonymous
264.description: I know, I'll copy IceBox, but remove all the blocks! Then I'll name it "Daves Arena"! Oy-vey...

265.title: Dead-Levels
265.author: Anonymous
265.description: Ever watch a car rust? This set ranks right up there in excitement. One level the author even states "I put no thought into this", and the trouble is, it shows.

281.title: Forsaken-Coliseum
281.author: Anonymous
281.description: Kinda big kinda un-wow, Charlie! Can you say boring? Try to say it again.

282.title: Fort Chaos.sit
282.author: Anonymous
282.description: This is version 1.0.9 for regular avara. There is another "Fort Chaos" for AfterShock. Chaos is right- there is no purpose to this fort level. No goal, just guards that you cannot kill. Almost nice - just missed it by '    '  that much.

283.title: FortChaos
283.author: Anonymous
283.description: The last released version of Anarchaos' popular level Fort Chaos (3.6 alpha 3). This level has a number of very notable features. Turrets that players have to man, destructable fort walls, and the ability to launch bombing raids, fire gigantic cruise missiles and call in air strikes. Unfortunately, Anarchaos never completely finished the level and it's missing custom BSP graphics and sounds, has a rather garish colour scheme and bugs that can allow players to cheat. Despite this, it's still one of the best Fort levels ever made for Avara and more than worth checking out if you're looking for a fun team map.

284.title: Fortress
284.author: Anonymous
284.description: Unlike a solidly built fortress, this level falls apart upon entering it.

289.title: FRED 2.5
289.author: Anonymous
289.description: Pack this away in the closet. Nothing you need.

290.title: Fukamachi
290.author: Anonymous
290.description: A very large, open arena. Too bad so many others are done much better than this.

292.title: Funky BoxV2
292.author: Anonymous
292.description: Yet another IceBox Clone. Yuck, this isn't funky, this is junky.

294.title: Fury-of-the-Four-Stomachs
294.author: Anonymous
294.description: Nice ideas, but usually over-polygonated (is that a word?)

296.title: Garbage Day
296.author: Anonymous
296.description: It certainly is garbage. This level wasn't even properly created - it has it's pict map included and it needed to play.

299.title: GoldenSky
299.author: Anonymous
299.description: Nothing here shouts "Play Me", rather it shouts "I was bored, let me make levels that no one will ever bother playing."

301.title: Graceland.sit
301.author: Anonymous
301.description: We're calling on the King to give this review. King?... Wise men say, only fools rush in...but I can't help... saying this level stinks.

304.title: Greens Arena
304.author: Anonymous
304.description: Green as in "I'm puking up food, and it's this weird green color." Save yourself, and your stomach.

305.title: Guide-Net-Levels1.5
305.author: Anonymous
305.description: Not even worth the download to look. Bawdy colors, huge layouts, and some incredibly sick color schemes. Some must have been fun to create, but to play they're horrible.

306.title: Gunship Lollipop.sit
306.author: Anonymous
306.description: Shirley Temple would not be proud.

307.title: Gunz v2.0.sit
307.author: Anonymous
307.description: Sorry- None of these Gunz things thrill me.

319.title: Hide
319.author: Anonymous
319.description: Hide is one of those maze-type levels that never really works for Avara. Walls are too tight - vision is too restricted.

320.title: HIV Positive
320.author: Anonymous
320.description: Doesn't matter if you have HIV or not- you can't see a damn thing in this level. Too bad - it looked like a good layout.

326.title: IceWorld
326.author: Anonymous
326.description: IceWorld is a lost level. It acts like it wants to be a solo level - but wants you to play multiplayer and team up. sigh Don't bother here.

331.title: Infinite Battles
331.author: Anonymous
331.description: A bit of Chaos might help this level... but then again- probably not.

144.title: CstmAvaraMod
144.author: Anonymous
144.description: Author: Nathan B Smith These are some "modded" avara apps that I was messing around with three to four years back or so, not too terribly long after avara came out. These are to have fun with, but will probably get boring quick. The changes are mainly these several different head models are used, and you are are now in hectors that are on major steroids.  The spacecraft models are ones I came up with, feel free to use however you want.  e-mail: NBSmith1701@yahoo.com  [admin] not tested - use at your own risk. email author concerning any trouble. [/admin]

150.title: GrukerV1B1.sit
150.author: Anonymous
150.description:
This is a BETA version Gruker is a level finding plugin. To find a level you must first have it download the master level list. This master list contains the 4 letter level tag associated with each level set and a url to obtain the set itself. Once the master list is downloaded, the plugin lets you enter the set tag you want, does a search in the master list and displays the url. If it does match it to a url, then you can download it by pressing the download button. This plugin use Fetch to do the ftp work. You must have Fetch and the user is responsible for any license required by Fetch.

Written and developed by Kenneth Payne (Avara aka Kiff)
Version 1.0 beta 1
3/13/2001
kbpayne@swbell.net
kiff@avara.net

157.title: photo
157.author: Anonymous
157.description: Lets you take better pictures of your levels by making several BSP's invisible. This way, you won't see the Hector or the scout.  This patch  saves a copy of Avara as "Avara Photographer" so you won't make a mistake and try to use it for net play. By Sam Handler.

220.title: BlocksForever.sit
220.author: Anonymous
220.description: This single Malkavian level has been incorporated into the AA Collection.

224.title: Botanica.sit
224.author: Anonymous
224.description: Yet another Malkavian set, this has been incorporated into the AA Collection.

229.title: BurningHorizon
229.author: Anonymous
229.description: These levels are included in the AA collection set.

247.title: Cold-Northern-Spaces
247.author: Anonymous
247.description: Ouch! This level crashes Avara everytime I've tried to look at it! Beware! Watchout! Don't Download this one! (Would another admin please try and either confirm this, or write the description.)

257.title: CultLevels
257.author: Anonymous
257.description:
Ok, you've downloaded Essential Levels.  Now what?  Well, here's another set of levels: old cult favorites.  These are the levels that two people in a server sometimes spontaneously start playing while everyone else stares at the words "mission not found," wondering what's going on.

Levels in this archive: A Bridge Too Far, Armageddon 2.0, AvaraScape Octagon, Avarathon 1.0.1, Blind, Castle Anthrax, Dodgeball 2.5, Holy Hand Grenades 2.0, Hunting Grounds 1.2, Maps with Balls, Robin Hood v1.1, SausageLevels 1.5, The Guantlet, and Topsy Turvy.

Levels not in this archive: Wrestling 4.0, because it's in Essential Levels, and Symbiosis, because it's too new.

280.title: FiveProv
280.author: Anonymous
280.description: This set has been combined into the Avara Collection 1 set.

288.title: Fracture
288.author: Anonymous
288.description: A nice level with some blow-up platforms. Worth a look.

332.title: Instability-remix.sit
332.author: Anonymous
332.description: A fun little distraction from regular Avara play. Give it a try when you're tired of Baghdad.

338.title: JohnB-Levels1.9.sit
338.author: Anonymous
338.description: This set has been combined into the Avara Collection 1 set.

345.title: Kings of the Hill
345.author: Anonymous
345.description: Some wonderfully bizarre levels brought to you by hybrid and muerte, these are mostly "abnormal" KOTH levels. If you're tired of Arsenic and the other over-played KOTH sets, grab this one!

355.title: Legacy of Belar.sit
355.author: Anonymous
355.description: The Red level is an archetype of the simple-is-better concept for level creators. The right balance of blocks, ramps and ammo make this level a classic that will endure time. Vengence is also good, although it is a bit big for 2 players. Well worth the download - grab it now!

405.title: Playground 1.4.sit
405.author: Anonymous
405.description: This set has been combined into the Avara Collection 1 set.

441.title: Spring.bin
441.author: Anonymous
441.description: This set has been combined into the Avara Collection 1 set.

467.title: the codex
467.author: Anonymous
467.description: A huge and excellent collection of normal and abnormal levels by Tyrant, one of the greatest Avara level designers. This set (The Codex 1.0.1) is huge, containing over 40(!) levels. It's broken into two files, one with normal levels and the other abnormal. The normal levels are the quality we would expect from Tyrant, with interesting and varied designs built to make the most out of Avaras gameplay mechanics, all while remaining a pleasure on the eyes. The abnormal levels offer a little bit of everything, including KOTH, wrestling, ball games and some more original designs such as a perfected version of the Rubber 'Nades level, all with the unique touch of Tyrant. A set that truly belongs in every collection.

471.title: Thumpers Playhouse
471.author: Anonymous
471.description: The amphitheatre was included in Geriatric Ward. The other level is not worth mentioning.
